content.webTitle: Martin goes for brain scan after heavy crash

fields.headline: Martin goes for brain scan after heavy crash
fields.bodyText: The Estonian Ford driver Markko Martin was taken to hospital yesterday suffering partial loss of vision after an accident on the fifth stage of the Rally of Argentina. Martin was in second place when he misjudged a narrow, flat-out corner at the end of a half-mile straight, clipped a bank and overturned a number of times. The impact was so severe that it smashed a hole in his crash helmet. He was initially taken to hospital in Cosquin, then transferred to Cordoba for a brain scan. His British co-driver "Beef" Park was severely shaken but otherwise unharmed. It remains to be seen if Martin takes part in rallies at Punchestown next week or in a warm-up for the next world championship round, in Finland in a fortnight. The Finnish Peugeot driver Marcus Gronholm held a wafer-thin lead over the Citroëns of Carlos Sainz and Sébastien Loeb, the world championship leader, after six of the 26 stages. A loose wire had hampered Loeb in the opening stages. Petter Solberg led until he damaged his Subaru fording a river, which demoted him to fourth.
